internetKitConfiguration.title: Internet Kit Configuration
internetKitConfiguration.subtitle: Enjoy fast, reliable internet anywhere — even in remote areas. We sell, install, and maintain satellite kits to keep you connected.

whyChooseStarlink.title: Why Choose Starlink?
whyChooseStarlink.description: Starlink is a revolutionary satellite internet constellation that provides high-speed internet access across the globe. Unlike traditional internet services, Starlink uses a network of low-Earth orbit satellites to deliver fast, reliable connectivity anywhere on the planet.

promises.promise2: Fast delivery straight to your door.

premium.title: Premium
premium.description: The all-in-one solution for demanding users!

promises.promise2: Fast and secure delivery to your door.
promises.promise5: 24/7 personalized support to answer all your questions.
promises.promise8: One free VIP bus ticket from an agency of your choice.

promises.promise1: Order your equipment in just a few clicks.
promises.promise4: Optimized setup by our expert team for maximum performance.
promises.promise5: Personalized follow-up to ensure total satisfaction.
promises.promise6: One free PREMIUM bus ticket from an agency of your choice.

question1.question: How fast is Starlink internet?
question1.answer: Starlink provides download speeds between 25-220 Mbps and upload speeds of 5-25 Mbps. Speeds vary based on location, time of day, and network congestion. Most users experience speeds sufficient for streaming, gaming, and video calls.

question2.question: How long does installation take?
question2.answer: Self-installation typically takes 15-30 minutes. Our professional installation service includes a site survey and takes 2-4 hours for complete setup and testing. We also provide training on system operation.

question3.question: Is Starlink affected by weather?
question3.answer: Starlink is designed to work in various weather conditions. Heavy snow or ice may temporarily affect signal, but the system is built to handle most weather scenarios. The dish includes heating elements to melt snow and ice.

question4.question: What is the monthly cost after installation?
question4.answer: Monthly service fees vary by plan and location. Residential plans typically start at $120/month, while business plans range from $250-500/month. Contact us for current pricing in your area.

question5.question: Can I move my Starlink to a different location?
question5.answer: Yes! Starlink offers portability options. The Mini and Roam kits are designed for easy relocation. Standard kits can be moved but may require service address updates and potential plan changes.

question6.question: How long does it take to start a project and deliver results?
question6.answer: Project kickoff typically takes 2-3 weeks, covering team setup and requirement analysis. Delivery timelines depend on project scope: simple websites (4-8 weeks), complex apps (3-12 months), enterprise solutions (6-18 months). You'll get a detailed roadmap upfront, with consistent progress updates at every stage.

question7.question: What technologies and skills do your teams specialize in?
question7.answer: Our teams are experts in modern tech stacks: Fronted (React, Vue.js, Angular), Backend (Node.js, Python, Java), Mobile (React Native, Flutter), Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes), AI/ML (Tenserflow, PyTorch), and databases (ProgreSQL, MongoDB). We stay sharp by constantly evolving with the latest tools and best practices.

ourJourney.title: Our Journey

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.p1: At <bold>Makiti SARL</bold>, the protection of personal data is a priority. This privacy policy describes how we collect, process, store and protect the personal data of users, partners, customers and employees when they use our digital services, particularly those offered via the Matoa platform and its associated
introduction.p2: This policy complies with <bold>Law No. 2010/012 of 21 December 2010 on cybersecurity and cybercrime in Cameroon</bold>, as well as the <bold>principles of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)</bold> as international best practice.

personalDataCollected.title: Personal data collected
personalDataCollected.p1: The categories of data that may be collected are as follows :
ul: <bold>Identification data :</bold>  surname, first name, telephone number, email address, postal address.
<bold>Professional data :</bold> company name, position, sector of activity.
<bold>Technical data :</bold> IP address, login details, device type, operating system, browsing logs.
<bold>Usage data :</bold> browsing history, user preferences, comments, feedback, frequency of use.
<bold>Financial data :</bold> information relating to commercial transactions and payments (excluding sensitive banking data, unless necessary and secure).

collectionMethod.title: Methods of collection
ul: When creating an account on our platforms (web or mobile).
Through online or paper forms.
When communicating with our services (customer support, sales department, etc.).
Through the use of cookies or other tracking technologies when browsing our websites or applications.

processingPurposes.title: Purposes of processing
processingPurposes.p1: Personal data is processed in a lawful, fair and transparent manner for the following purposes :
ul: To enable secure and personalised access to our digital services.
To optimise the functioning of the platform and improve the user experience.
To provide technical support, send relevant notifications or offer targeted offers.
To manage contractual relationships and administrative obligations.
To ensure compliance with legal, regulatory or judicial obligations.

dataDisclosure.title: Data disclosure
dataDisclosure.p1: <bold>Makiti SARL</bold> undertakes never to sell or rent the personal data it collects. However, certain data may be disclosed to third parties in the following cases :
ul: To our <bold>technical service providers</bold> (hosting, IT management, maintenance) who are contractually bound by confidentiality obligations.
To <bold>commercial partners</bold> acting strictly within the scope of service provision.
To the <bold>competent authorities</bold> (administrative, tax or judicial), upon legal and reasoned request.

retentionPeriod.title: Retention period
retentionPeriod.p1: Data is retained for the period strictly necessary for the purposes for which it was collected, unless a legal obligation imposes a longer period (e.g. retention for evidence purposes, fraud prevention or tax obligations).
retentionPeriod.p2: At the end of these periods, the data is securely deleted or anonymised.

dataSecurity.title: Data security
dataSecurity.p1: <bold>Makiti SARL</bold> applies physical, logical and organisational security measures in accordance with international standards to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of data, including in particular :
ul: Access control and authentication.
Encryption of sensitive data.
Access logging and security alerts.
Regular compliance audits and vulnerability tests.

yourRights.title: Your rights
yourRights.p1: In accordance with the <bold>aforementioned Cameroonian Law No. 2010/012</bold> and GDPR best practices, you have the following rights :
ul: <bold>Right of access</bold> to your personal data
<bold>Right to rectify</bold>, update or delete your inaccurate or obsolete data.
<bold>Right to object</bold> to the processing of your data for legitimate reasons.
<bold>Right to withdraw consent</bold>, at any time for processing based on consent.
<bold>Right to portability</bold>, where applicable, within the limits provided for by law.
yourRights.p2: To exercise your rights, please contact us at the following address : <bold><email>contact@makiti-group.cm</email></bold>

cookiesAndTrackers.title: Cookies and trackers
cookiesAndTrackers.p1: Our platforms may use cookies or similar technologies for the following purposes :
ul: To facilitate navigation.
To measure audience size.
To improve performance and usability.
To display personalised content.
cookiesAndTrackers.p2: You can configure your browser to restrict or refuse cookies. However, some features may not function properly without cookies.

policyChanges.title: Policy changes
policyChanges.p1: <bold>Makiti SARL</bold> reserves the right to modify this policy at any time to reflect legal, technical or functional changes to its services.
policyChanges.p2: Changes will take effect as soon as they are published on our website. The date of the last update will be indicated at the top of the document.

contact.title: Contact
contact.p1: For any questions regarding this privacy policy or your personal data, you can contact us using the following contact details :

termsAndConditions.title: Terms and Conditions of Use (TCU) – Makiti SARL
termsAndConditions.p2: Welcome to the Makiti SARL platform. By accessing our digital services, applications or websites, you unreservedly accept these Terms and Conditions of Use (TCU). Please read them carefully before use.

presentation.title: Presentation of Makiti SARL
presentation.p1: Makiti SARL is a company incorporated under Cameroonian law, registered in the Trade and Personal Property Credit Register (RCCM) under number <bold><italic>M052318275229B</italic></bold>, with its registered office located in Yaoundé-Santa Barbara, opposite Sonel. It develops and provides digital solutions to facilitate access to products and services, in particular via its <bold>Matoa</bold> platform and associated applications.

definitions.title: Definitions
definitions.p1: In these Terms of Use, the terms below have the following meanings :
ul: <bold>“User”</bold> : any natural or legal person using the digital services offered by Makiti SARL.
<bold>“Services”</bold> : all features accessible via the websites, applications or interfaces made available by Makiti.
<bold>“Content”</bold> : any data, information, text, image, sound, video or element made available via the services.
<bold>“User account”</bold> : a personal and secure space created by a user to access certain services.

purposes.title: Purpose of the T&Cs
purposes.p1: The purpose of these T&Cs is to define the terms and conditions of access, use and operation of the digital services provided by Makiti SARL.

servicesAccess.title: Access to services
servicesAccess.p1: Access to the services is open to anyone with an Internet connection. Certain features may require the prior creation of a <bold>user account</bold> or <bold>secure authentication</bold>
ul: Provide accurate, complete and up-to-date information when registering.
Keep their login details confidential.
Immediately inform Makiti SARL in the event of fraudulent use of their account.

responsibleServicesUsage.title: Responsible use of services
ul: Use the services in accordance with the laws and regulations in force in <bold>Cameroon</bold>, in particular <bold>Law No. 2010/012 of 21 December 2010</bold> on cybersecurity and cybercrime, as well as the principles of the <bold>GDPR</bold> for users located in the European Union.
Not publish content that is illegal, harmful, violent, abusive, defamatory or infringes on the rights of third parties.
Refrain from any attempt to intrude or compromise the integrity of the platform (hacking, exploitation of vulnerabilities, etc.).
Not misuse the services for commercial purposes not authorised by Makiti SARL.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.p1: All elements constituting the platforms, services and content distributed by Makiti SARL (text, graphics, logos, software, interfaces, codes, etc.) are protected by <bold>intellectual property</bold> laws.
intellectualProperty.p2: Any unauthorised reproduction, representation, distribution or use is strictly prohibited without the prior written consent of Makiti SARL.

personalDataProtection.title: Protection of personal data
personalDataProtection.p1: Makiti SARL is committed to respecting the privacy of its users. Personal data collected is processed in accordance with <bold>Cameroonian law</bold> (Law No. 2010/012) and, where applicable, the <bold>GDPR</bold> for European users.
personalDataProtection.p2: You can consult our Privacy Policy to learn more about the collection, use, storage and rights associated with your personal data.

availabilityAndMaintenance.title: Availability and maintenance
availabilityAndMaintenance.p1: Makiti SARL strives to ensure continuous availability of services. However, it cannot be held responsible for interruptions due to :
ul: Scheduled maintenance operations.
A technical failure beyond its control.
Force majeure (network outage, natural disaster, etc.).

limitationOfLiability.title: Limitation of liability
limitationOfLiability.p1: Makiti SARL cannot be held liable for any direct or indirect damage resulting from the use or inability to use the services, including but not limited to
ul: Loss of data.
Technical malfunctions.
Content published by third-party users.
limitationOfLiability.p2: The user remains solely responsible for their comments, publications and activities on the platform.

suspensionAndTermination.title: Suspension and termination
suspensionAndTermination.p1: Makiti SARL reserves the right to <bold>temporarily or permanently suspend</bold> a user's access to the services, <bold>without notice</bold>, in the event of a breach of these Terms of Use or behaviour that is harmful to the platform or other users.
suspensionAndTermination.p2: The user may also request the deletion of their account at any time by sending a simple request to : <bold><email>contact@makiti-group.cm</email><bold>

termsModification.title: Changes to the Terms of Use
termsModification.p1: Makiti SARL reserves the right to modify these Terms of Use at any time. Any changes will be updated on the platform.
termsModification.p2: Continued use of the services after publication constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

applicableLawAndJuridiction.title: Applicable law and jurisdiction
applicableLawAndJuridiction.p1: These Terms of Use are governed by <bold>Cameroonian law</bold>.
applicableLawAndJuridiction.p2: In the event of a dispute, the parties will endeavour to resolve the dispute amicably. Failing this, <bold>the competent courts of the jurisdiction of Makiti SARL's registered office</bold> (Yaoundé) shall have sole jurisdiction, unless otherwise provided by law.

contact.title: Contact
contact.p1: For any questions, complaints or requests for information relating to these Terms of Use, you can contact us at the following address :

websitePublisher.title: Website publisher
websitePublisher.p1: This website is published by Makiti SARL, a limited liability company with capital of  <bold>995.000 XAF</bold> FCFA, registered in the Yaoundé Trade and Personal Property Credit Register under number RCCM  <bold>RC/YAO/2023/B/1069 du 25 Avril 2023</bold>, and identified with the tax authorities under taxpayer number <bold>M052318275229B</bold>

headOffice.title: Head office
headOffice.p4: Represented by : M. Aboubakar Ousmanou, in his capacity as Manager

hosting.title: Hosting
hosting.p1: The website is hosted by: <bold>(Name of host)</bold>

websitePurpose.title: Objet du site
websitePurpose.p1: <link1>www.makiti-group.com</link1> is to present the services and products of Makiti SARL, particularly in the fields of digital technology, logistics, e-commerce and digital services via the Matoa platform.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual property
intellectualProperty.p1: All content on this website (text, images, videos, logos, graphic charter, interfaces, source codes, etc.) is the <bold>exclusive property of Makiti SARL</bold>, unless otherwise stated, and is protected by Cameroonian and international intellectual property laws.
intellectualProperty.p2: Any reproduction, representation, modification, publication or adaptation of all or part of the elements of the site, regardless of the means or process used, is prohibited without the prior written authorisation of Makiti SARL.

dataProtection.title: Personal data protection
dataProtection.p1: Makiti SARL undertakes to respect the privacy of users and to ensure the protection of personal data in accordance with Cameroonian Law No. 2010/012 of 21 December 2010 on cybersecurity and cybercrime, and, to the extent applicable, Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR).

collectedData.title: Data collected
collectedData.p1: The data that may be collected includes, in particular: surname, first name, email address, telephone number, IP address, browsing data, and any other information voluntarily provided by the user via the website forms or the use of the services.

processingPurposes.title: Purpose of processing
processingPurposes.p1: The data is processed for the following purposes: managing contact requests, improving services, managing user accounts, statistical analysis, commercial communication subject to the user's consent, and website security.

retentionPeriod.title: Retention period
retentionPeriod.p1: The data is retained for a period not exceeding that necessary for the purposes for which it was collected, unless otherwise required by law.

userRights.title: User rights
userRights.p1: In accordance with applicable regulations, you have the right to access, rectify, delete, limit the processing of, object to, on legitimate grounds, and transfer your data.
userRights.p2: To exercise your rights, please contact us by post at our head office address.

dataTransfer.title: Transfer outside CEMAC or the EU
dataTransfer.p1: No transfer of personal data outside Cameroon or the EU is carried out without appropriate safeguards.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.p1: Cookies may be placed on the user's device to improve the browsing experience, compile statistics, or ensure the functioning of the site.
cookies.p2: Users can configure their browser to refuse cookies at any time.

liability.title: Liability
liability.p1: Makiti SARL endeavours to ensure that the information published on the site is accurate and regularly updated. However, it cannot be held liable for any errors, omissions or unavailability of information or services. Users use the site under their sole responsibility.

applicableLawAndJuridiction.title: Applicable law and jurisdiction
applicableLawAndJuridiction.p1: These legal notices are governed by Cameroonian law. In the event of a dispute, jurisdiction is assigned to the competent courts of Cameroon.

contact.title: Contact
contact.p1: For any questions regarding these legal notices, the use of the website or your personal data:
